location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.308 of 1851 from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Indian Naval Squadron, Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Hennell writes to Porter, informing him of the Bushire Assistant Surgeon James McAlister's grievances again him (f 15). Hennell quotes McAlister at length. The circumstances of the grievances relate to the drunken conduct at the Residency of one of Porter's men, and McAlister's request to Porter that the man in question be removed to prevent any chance of injuries occurring. McAlister's complaint lies in the 'most unqualified manner' in which Porter responded to his request.
